'''Update Manager''' is a [[Linux]] utility for updating [[software package]]s. Via a background [[daemon (computer software)|daemon]], it can notify the user of updated packages, and optionally download and install them. It is a [[GTK+]] [[frontend]] to the [[Advanced Packaging Tool|APT]] [[package management system]], but unlike full-featured [[package manager]]s such as [[Synaptic Package Manager|Synaptic]], it cannot be used to add or remove packages.
'''Update Manager''' is a [[Linux]] utility for updating [[software package]]s. Via a background [[daemon (computer software)|daemon]], it can notify the user of updated packages, and optionally download and install them. It is a [[GTK+]] [[frontend]] to the [[Advanced Packaging Tool|APT]] [[package management system]], but unlike full-featured [[package manager]]s such as [[Synaptic Package Manager|Synaptic]], it cannot be used to add or remove packages.
â
Written as a core utility for the [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] desktop, it is also part of [[Debian]] ''unstable'' and can run on other APT-based systems.
+
Written as a core utility for the [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] desktop, it is also part of [[Debian]] ''unstable'' and can run on other APT-based systems.
